Chunguang Huo

Lund, Sweden · +46 793514252 · huochunguang2021@163.com

From an early age, I have been deeply passionate about electronics design and production, successfully creating an electronic boat entirely by hand during middle school. Throughout my undergraduate studies, I consistently excelled in various national and provincial competitions, including awards in Mathematical Modeling, the National Computer Design Competition, three consecutive years of provincial awards in the Liaoning Provincial Computer Design Competition, the TI Cup Electronic Design Competition, and the Provincial Physics Competition. In 2020, I received a provincial award in the Innovation, Creativity, and Entrepreneurship Challenge, winning both the Best Innovation and Best Creativity awards (only two recipients university-wide). During my undergraduate period, I led one provincial-level project, participated in three of my advisor’s projects, and successfully obtained three patents. My primary responsibilities involved embedded system design, research in wireless sensing algorithms, and IoT system construction. In recognition of my academic excellence, I was awarded the prestigious China Aerospace CASC Scholarship in 2021 (only 24 recipients university-wide). From 2020 to 2022, I twice earned the Special-Class Scholarship (only 17 recipients campus-wide), was awarded the Technology Academic Scholarship for three consecutive years, and was consistently recognized as an outstanding student. Additionally, in 2022, I was honored as having one of the best graduation projects at the university and named an Outstanding Graduate of Liaoning Province. In terms of practical experience, I worked as an embedded development and 5G base station maintenance intern in 2020. By the end of 2022, I received employment offers from multiple prestigious institutions, including the TianJi Team at the Tsinghua University Center for Brain-inspired Computing Research, Datang Telecom, and the Chinese Academy of Sciences’ Space Application Center (as the only fresh undergraduate selected). Ultimately, I joined the Chinese Academy of Sciences to focus on GNSS onboard receiver development, participating in significant projects such as DRO orbital satellites and the SMILE mission (a China-Europe collaboration). From 2023 to 2025, I pursued my Master's degree in Wireless Communications at Lund University in Sweden, specializing in wireless channels, channel coding, machine learning, and MIMO technologies.
